content0.text: What's New in Far Cry 6
This page is an overview of everything new to expect in Far Cry 6. Details on Amigos, Vehicles and Equipment.

1.Amigos  : 
 
 Companions, which are known as Amigos, are Animal Companions that’ll join you on your journey across Yara in Far Cry 6. There are six Amigo’s you can choose from and they are the following:  
- Guapo
  - Chorizo
  - Chicharrón
  - Boom Boom
  - Oluso
  - Champagne
  - K-9000
  *Note: K-9000 and Champagne are two additional Amigos you can acquire from DLC.
These Amigos will help you in combat and each one can unlock different abilities that’ll improve their usefulness. For example, Guapo can automatically regenerate health.

2.The Largest Map in the Far Cry Series : 
 
  Far Cry 6 features one of the largest maps in the series, Yara, which is controlled by a dictator named Anton Castillo. You’ll find a variety of biomes that will keep the scenery new and exciting to explore. Here you’ll be able to find many different types of collectibles, such as USB Sticks that include songs along with hidden Roosters!

3.Vehicle Customisation  : 
 
  Vehicles aren’t anything new to the series, but Far Cry 6 features a variety of different upgrades and customization options to help make the perfect ride for your long drives.

4.New Mounts : 
 
  Far Cry has had mounts throughout the series, but Far Cry 6 includes Horses that you can not only ride but can also use weapons to defend yourself on your trips.

5.Equipment  : 
 
  -> Stats
Far Cry 6 features clothing that has different perks which will improve certain stats such as improving stealth capabilities. You’ll want to make sure your equipment is up to scratch before entering missions to make your objective easier to achieve.
-> Supremo backpacks
Supremo backpacks are a new addition to the series and they feature powerful abilities and weapons, such as being able to fire rockets from the Exterminador Backpack.
Essential Tips
This page is designed to give you tips you’ll need to prepare for your adventure through Yara. Details on Equipment, Combat and more.
Always Scout Ahead!

As you go into enemy camps in Yara you’ll want to bring up your phone by pressing up on the D-PAD to tag any enemies before going in. Along with this you’ll be able to spot any traps lurking about to give you a better chance of maintaining stealth in the missions.
Upgrade Equipment!

In Far Cry 6 you’ll be able to purchase/find new Armor and Weapons. Make sure you regularly check and upgrade your equipment before going into missions to prevent being easily killed. Also, make sure you play around with the different Supremo Backpacks until you find one that matches your playstyle.

Make sure to add Suppressors to your weapons when you have the resources, as this will allow you to take out enemies from a distance or up close without being seen. This will help you stay stealthy throughout the missions.
Loot Everything!

Make sure to pick up any items you come across in Yara, as stuff like Uranium, Metal and Gasoline is extremely useful for crafting/purchasing new equipment and you can build new stations in camps by interacting with the Construction Desk to give you access to bonus features, such as being able to purchase Hunting Brochures to reveal Hunting Spots.
Camp Facilities
This page is an overview of the different Facilities you can unlock in Far Cry 6.
How To Unlock Camp Facilities

You’ll be able to unlock Camp Facilities by playing through the story until you complete the mission, Libertad Rises and arrive at the Montero Farm. Interact with the Construction Counter to be greeted with two blank boxes that you can choose from two of the following facilities.

   Hideout Network
   Bandidos Barracks
   Guerilla Garrison
   La Cantina
    Hunter’s Lodge
    Fishing Hut
These Facilities are the same in any camp you visit in Yara, so make sure to choose different ones in order to gain access to different facilities
What Does Each Facility Do?
What Does The Hideout Network Do?
The Hideout Network gives you access to Fast Travel locations throughout Yara as well as Wingsuit. Additionally, you can purchase maps which will lead you to different Guerilla Camps.
What Does The Guerilla Garrison Do?

The Guerilla Garrison will give you and the Guerillas access to more weapons in the shop and you’ll have access to Recon Laptops throughout Yara which you can use to prepare for possible threats you’ll face before entering enemy bases.
What Does The La Cantina Do?

The La Cantina will give you the option to cook food which will give you temporary buffs that’ll give you an advantage over your opponents. As The La Cantina upgrades further you’ll have access to more meals.
What Does The Hunter’s Lodge Do?

The Hunter’s Lodge allows you to purchase Hunting Brochures which will allow you to see Hunting Spots that are hidden across Yara. This will help you acquire materials to either upgrade equipment or cook food.
What Does The Fishing Hut Do?
The Fishing Hut allows you to purchase Fishing Brochures which will allow you to see Fishing Spots. Like the Hunter’s Lodge you’ll be able to use the materials to upgrade equipment or cook food.
How To Get All 8 Leaders
This page is a guide on where to find all 8 Los Bandidos Leaders in Far Cry 6.
What Are Los Bandidos?

Los Bandidos is a gamemode in Far Cry 6 where you send out squads you’ve recruited throughout Yara on missions that take real time to complete. Spend your time doing other things, such as Main Operations, Yaren Stories or even Treasure Hunts, then return to the board and pick up your long awaited rewards.

However, before you can send out squads on missions you’ll need to recruit leaders which are more skillful soldiers that have their own unique abilities. Below you’ll find the names of the Los Bandidos Leaders which can be recruited.
How To Get Los Bandidos Leaders
How To Get Benito

Benito is automatically unlocked when you unlock the Los Bandidos Operations. Benito comes with the following skills, Surveyor: +50% Construction success chance and Constructor: -50% Metal requirements.
How To Get Alfredo Maximo

Alfredo Maximo is unlocked by completing the operation The Lion’s Roar which takes place in El Este. Alfredo Maximo comes with the following skills, Smooth Talker: +50% Bribery success chance and Thrifty: -50% Pesos requirements.
How To Get Big Papi

Big Papi is unlocked by completing the Yaran Story “Big Papi in Little Yara.” which is located on Duende Island. Big Papi comes with the following skills, Reckless: +50% Assault success chance and Speed Demon: -25% Bandido Operation time.
How To Get Freddy Jr

Freddy Jr is unlocked by completing the Yaran Story “Stealing Home” which is acquired by speaking with guerilla’s throughout Yara. Freddy Jr comes with the following skills, Sniper: +50% Sniper success chance
and Long Shot: Choosing Sniper action gives +10% success chance until end of Operation.
How to Get Isabela and Marisol

Isabela is unlocked by completing the Yaran Story “Wing and a Prayer” which can be found in Noventarmas. Isabela comes with the following skills, Surprise!: +50% Ambush success chance and Adaptive: +10% success chance to one choice for each step.

Marisol comes with the following skills, Inquirer: +50% Interrogate success chance and Field Medic: -50% Medicine requirements.
How to Get Sergio

Sergio is unlocked by completing the Yaran Story “Tricks of the Trade” which can be found in Concepcion. Sergio comes with the following skills, Ghillie Suit: +50% Stealth success chance and Super Sneak: Choosing Stealth action gives additional intel about Leader suitability for other Bandido Operations.
How to Get Zenia

Zenia is unlocked by completing the following Yaran Stories, Stealing Thunder, Heavy Metal and Paint the Town. Zenia comes with the following skills, Sabotage: +50% Sabotage success chance and Resourceful: -50% Gasolina requirements.

content1.text: Model Citizen
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Model Citizen. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to eliminating Rodrigo Lecoste.
Description
This crazy artist named Rodrigo Lecoste uses human materials in his art. Kill him before anyone else gets hurt.
Kill Rodrigo Lecoste

Head northwest of Ida’s Refuge to find Chica Nunez walking about on the beach. Speak with her then you’ll be requested to take down Rodrigo Lacoste. After the conversation has come to a close, travel south of your current location until you reach Barrio Del Princepe.

You’ll have to deal with multiple soldiers surrounding Rodrigo, so a good strategy here is to climb to the roof of a nearby building and take them down with silenced sniper, such as the El Tirano. After you’ve cleared out the guards and taken down Rodrigo Lacoste, leave the area and wait for the call with Chica to end for this Yaren Story to be completed.
Spur of the Moment
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Spur of the Moment. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to finding Elvis’s favourite Rooster, El Pollo Loco.
Description
That hijo de puta Ramon rigged the cockfight and stole Gordito’s spurs. Find Ramon and get those spurs back.
Steal back Elvis’s favourite spurs from Ramon

Once you’ve completed the main operation “Meet the Monteros”, speak with Elvis at the Monteros Camp and he’ll request you steal back his favourite Rooster. Exit the camp and head southwest of Ida’s Refuge in the Aguas Lindas Region to find a tunnel that’ll lead to a bunker that Ramon is hiding out in.

Head inside and follow the corridor along until you stumble across Ramon’s corpse. Collect the Key from the floor and proceed to the next room to find a Rooster in the corner, then make your way down the stairs to find a cave that’ll lead you to an area where Elvis’s favourite rooster, El Pollo Loco is located.
Escape Ramon’s Bunker

Keep your distance and attack it until you deplete its health, then quickly sprint out of the bunker whilst avoiding the swarm of Roosters on your tail. Finally, take the truck and drive away until Dani calls Elvis, then returns to camp and speak with Elvis in person to bring this Yaren Story to a close.
Over Easy
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Over Easy. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to finding the 50 juiced-up rooster eggs.
Description
Ramon juiced-up roosters escaped and now they’re causing shit. Get me one of their eggs.
Collect a juiced-up rooster egg for Elvis

Once you’ve completed the Yaren Story Spur of the Moment, speak with Elvis at the Monteros Camp to start this follow up quest. After the conversation has come to a close, travel to the Esmeralda Eco Farm which is located northeast of the town of Vedera. Upon arrival, collect one Juiced-Up Egg, then you’ll need to destroy the remaining 49 eggs which are in the following locations.

   First set of 10 can be found in the Shed with a yellow door.
   Second set of 10 can be found in the middle of the farm
    Third set of 10 can be found in a hut opposite the yellow doored shed.
    The fourth set of 10 can be found underneath the house at the top of the hill.
    The fifth and final set are found inside the house.
After you’ve destroyed all the eggs, take the one you collected back to Elvis at Monteros Camp to bring this Yaren Story to a close.
Undercover Stud
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Undercover Stud. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to finding Capitan Diaz.
Description

Rendezvous with one of my people who is currently working undercover at a military horse training ground. Keep your eyes open. Like all covert missions, you will either be stepping in manure or getting a fancy trophy.
Meet Gilberto’s “chameleon”

Once you’ve completed the main operation Bullet Points, speak with Gilberto Rosario at Cardoso Mill which is located southwest of Catalina Ridge in the La Joya sub region. After the conversation has come to a close, travel southwest of Lapida Mogote in the Sierra Perdida sub region to find the El Este Naval Stables.

Before you go in and look for Capitan Diaz you’ll need to clear out the soldiers surrounding the area first. Here you can either go in with full force and eliminate them before they manage to call in reinforcements or alternatively you can climb up to the top of the hill over to the right of the entrance and bring out your phone to tag every enemy inside.

After you’ve gotten a good idea of what to expect, equip a silenced weapon, such as the Supercharger Shotgun or the El Tirano Sniper Rifle. If you opt to go along with the sniper rifle method, then stay up on the hill and snip all the enemies down before entering.

Tip
Make sure to aim for a headshot when sniping the enemies, as if you miss they’ll be alerted and begin shooting causing other enemies to call for reinforcements.

If you don’t have a silenced sniper, then equip any you have available and enter the area via the south entrance and follow the east wall around to reach the north entrance. Shoot down the guy sitting in the watchtower and disable the alarm. From here, continue slowly walking to the opposite side, then pick off the enemies when they aren’t looking before approaching the marked door and speaking with Capitan Diaz.
Escort Capitan Diaz

All that’s left for you to do now is follow Sergio and Diaz whilst remaining crouched, then when they hide from any enemies ahead, follow their lead and do the same or quickly take them out before anyone else gets alerted. Continue doing this, then when you reach the location the Yaren Story will be completed.
Stealing Home
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Stealing Home. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to locating and stealing back the Glove, Jersey and Jock Strap.
Description

My papa’s gear was stolen from his shrine by the army. Freddy Fonseca Sr. was a legend - the Maestro of the Malecon - and inspiration to Yarens everywhere. Secure a win for the home team and bring his stuff back to his shrine.
Find the Legendary Baseball Memorabilia

Head east of the town of Segunda to find the Segunda Field. Speak with Freddy Fonseca to start this Yaren Story, then three FND Bases where the Baseball Memorabilia is located will be marked on your map.
Find Baseball Glove

To begin you’re going to go and collect the Glove which is found at the FND Base: CCE Electrical Station 31 in the La Joya Sub Region. You’ll need to take down a yellow enemy to acquire the Office Key which will unlock the building where the Glove is stored.

Make your way over to the backend of the base and climb up onto the tower and bring out your phone by pressing up on the d-pad to scout out the area. Here you’ll find two Heavy Gunners and an Engineer by the front gate, then take a look to the back or end of the building to find a security camera and Engineer by the door.

Bring out a silenced weapon and shoot down the camera, then aim for a headshot and pick off the engineer when he isn’t looking. Next up you’ll want to take down the enemies closest to you to avoid alerting anyone, then after the normal enemies are dealt with, take out the yellow. Approach the body and pick up the key, then enter the small office by the entrance to find the Glove on the wall.
Find the Jersey

Next up, you’re going to steal back the Jersey which is located at the FND Base: FND Special Forces Base in the Barrial sub region. Upon arrival, take out the single guard at the entrance then proceed inside and go along the path on the right side. Along the way to the marker you’ll find a camera and two enemies in the alleys. Use a silenced weapon to take them out to avoid alerting the base.

As you reach the backend of the base, climb up to the roof and use your phone to scout out the area. Clear out the enemies on the rooftops and then takedown the yellow named area in front of the marked building. Collect the Armory Keycard and then enter the armory to find the Jersey on the wall.
Find the Jock Strap

It’s now time to grab the Jock Strap which can be found at the FND Base: Espinosa University in the Aguas Lindas sub region. Go into the building from the left side as there’s not many enemies, then go up to the third floor but watch out for the tripwire along the way.

Here you’ll want to look for a yellow named area patrolling the area, then take him down to acquire the Classroom Keycard. Use the keycard to enter the marked room and pick up the Jock Strap from the wall. Finally, go to the town of Feroza in the Balaceras, then go to the blue marked shrine and drop off the baseball Memorabilia to bring this yaren story to a close.
The Seeds of Love
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story The Seeds of Love. Details on where to find all of Lorenzo’s Children.
How To Start The Seeds of Love

Before you can begin the Yaren Story The Seeds of Love you’ll need to complete the following quests, Meet the Legends and The First Love, then talk to Lorenzo at Patriotas Peak. You’ll now be given photos of which will be a clue on where to find the children.
Lorenzo’s Children Locations
Child Location #1
Head southeast of Nueva Vida of the Sierra Perdida to find Barriga Town. Here you’ll want to speak with one of the children in the white building.
Child Location #2

Head to Perdomo Farm which is located northwest of Savannah Fields, then you’ll want to look for a building with a red door. However, you’ll need to find the Lorenzo Door Key which is located on a table of the stall opposite.
Child Location #3

Head to Oceguera Farm which is located southeast of Savannah Fields, then you’ll want to look for a flower on a workbench. Interact with it, then another one of Lorenzo’s children until you can speak with her.
Child Location #4
Head northwest of Promise Peaks to find a small village. Here you’ll want to look for a blue building, then climb up to the roof of the building opposite and shoot the lock through the window.
Child Location #5
Head to Todos Santos Cemetery which is located northwest of Robustas Hill in the Sierra Perdida Region. Here you’ll want to go up the hill to find one of Lorenzo’s Children pretending to be a zombie.
Child Location #6
Head northeast of Isabel Steppes to find Flores Farm in the Conuco Region. Upon arrival, pet the dog, then follow it to its owner which just happens to be another one of Lorenzo’s Children.
However, the dog has a chance to bug out, so cross the river and follow the path along to the right until you reach a camp.
Child Location #7
Head to the town of Concepcion and look for Corazon Alley which is on the west side of town. Here you’ll find a Child of Lorezno doing some graffiti.
Tricks of the Trade
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Tricks of the Trade. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to finding three Admiral Benitez billboards.
Description

We have their captain. They have our Felicia. It’s time to make a trade! Go let the regime know that we are open to negotiating and will gladly trade a military man with last year’s haircut for the best spy in all of Yara.
Vandalize the Admiral Benitez billboards

Return to Cardoso Mill and speak with Gilberto Rosario again upon completing the Yaren Story, Undercover Stud. After the conversation head to the Fernando Local Radio station which is located southwest of the Fernando Valley. Take out the couple enemies standing around, then enter the building and pick up the posters from the desk.

Gather the Scraps, Metal and Medicine from the building before leaving, then you’ll need to locate billboards of Admiral Benitez around Yara to vandalize. These billboards are located in the Sierra Perdida sub-region and you’ll find them in the following locations
Admiral Benitez billboard location #1

Head along the road west of Vacia Coast Military Archives to find one of the billboards sitting on the right side of the road. Climb up to it via the bus stop behind it and then interact with it to give it a fresh look.
Admiral Benitez billboard location #2
Head to the beach at the southeast corner of Vacia Coast and look for a digger. Defeat the few enemies standing near it, then climb up on to the digger and interact with the billboard.
Admiral Benitez billboard location #3
Head to the village south of the Bolero Hideout, then walk up the hill and zipline down to the billboard.
Admiral Benitez billboard location #4
Head southwest of the Bolero Hideout, then you’ll find the billboard on the corner of a junction. Climb up to it via the containers.
Admiral Benitez billboard location #5
Head along the Robusta Hills road and you’ll find the billboard southwest of the Ceballos Farm. Climb up onto the structure for the Punto de Venta shop to reach it.
Supremacy
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Supremacy. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to eliminating all of Juan’s Weapons.
Description
You want more toys? Bring me back Depleted Uranium from those Anti-Aircraft Sites, then go wild with my Supremos and Resolver Weapons. Remember, rank up and I’ll have even more in store for you.
Acquire Depleted Uranium

In order to purchase the resolver weapons and supremos from Juan’s Arms Dealers you’ll need to collect Depleted Uranium from containers which are stored in Anti-Aircraft-Cannons sites throughout Yara.
Acquire all of Juan’s weapons

This Yaren Story will automatically start during the main operation, The Guerrilla. Here you’ll need to collect all 5 Supremos and 11 Resolver Weapons which are sold by Juan. Below you’ll find every Resolver and Supremo and how to acquire them.
Stealing Thunder
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Stealing Thunder. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to acquiring a tank for Zenia.
Description
Let’s get creative. Steal a tank from the military, then bring it back to my garage so I can realize my vision.
Steal a tank for Zenia

Head northwest of Monjas Valley until you reach the La Traiada Mural, then speak with Zenia Zayas who can be found doing some graffiti. After the conversation has come to a close, travel to a location marked on your map to find a tunnel where the tank is stored.

Disable the alarm and take out the two cameras with a silenced weapon to prevent alerting the enemies, then quietly take out the enemies before jumping into the tank and delivering it to Zenia. Along the way you may have some enemies on your tail but they shouldn’t cause you much trouble as they can be taken down in one shot from the trusty cannon.
Heavy Metal
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story, Heavy Metal. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to destroying the correct billboards.
Description
Our vision is almost complete. Now you just need to take that beautiful tank and blow up billboards in Verdera.
Destroy the Jose Castillo billboards
After you’ve completed the Yaren Story Stealing Thunder, speak with Zenia Zayas again and you’ll be requested to destroy eight of the Jose Castillo billboards in the town of Verdera.

Take the tank from the garage and drive on down to the town, then you’ll want to look for large red boards that say La Fuerza which are scattered all over. As you approach a billboard the game will place a large marker on it which makes it pretty difficult to miss. Upon destroying the billboards you’ll have a quick call with Zenia and the Yaren Story will come to a close.
Triada Relic
This is a walkthrough for the Yaren Story Triada Relic in Far Cry 6. Details on where to find all three relics.
How To Start Triada Relic

To begin the Triada Relic Quest you’ll want to enter Oluwa’s Cave which is located east of Clara’s Camp. Upon accepting the quest you’ll need to find the following three relics.

Ida’s Triada Relic
Oku’s Triada Relic
Mimo Abosi’s Triada Relic
Ida’s Triada Relic Location

Head to Dos Monjdas Mogote which is located in Lozania to find the Ida Triada Relic Treasure Hunt. Here you’ll want to use the grapple points to climb up. then follow the path up until you reach a cave entrance. Inside you’ll see a bunch of ziplines that you’ll want to jump between to reach the next part of the cave.

You’ll now need to jump between three ziplines to reach the next area, then continue following the path ahead until you reach another zipline which is blocked off by wooden planks. Shoot it down before continuing, then follow the narrow path ahead using the grapple points and ziplines to reach the end of the cave and Ida’s Relic will be awaiting.
Oku’s Triada Relic Location

Head to Fort Oro which is located in the northwest corner of Cruz Del Salvador. Accept the quest, then enter the room on the right to find several mirrors. Here you’ll want to smash the first one next to the door to reveal a switch, then interact with it to open a door on the opposite side of the hallway. Read the Short Instructions on the table, then press the buttons on the center table in the following order:

Middle
Left
Right

Make your way upstairs and inspect the Note in Sheet Music Margins, then enter the now revealed secret room which contains a Dungeon Key. Now go back downstairs and unlock the final door, then head down into the basement. Shoot the boarded up door, then proceed into the room full of mannequin.

Interact with the red button at the back left of the room, then continue following the path around to find a grapple point that you’ll want to use to get up to the roof. Zipline down to the well, then use the grapple point above it to safely descend into. Finally, swing across to the ledge to acquire the Oku’s Triada Relic.
Mimo Abosi’s Triada Relic Location

Head west of Mirador Cape to find Mckay Global Drill Sited D. Accept the Mimo Abosi’s Triada Relic, then turn off the generator before shooting the lock and entering the cave. Here you’ll want to go left to find a Fan Room Keycard on the floor next to a corpse, then take the right path and swim across to the next area.
Go into the room on the left and interact with the switch, then go through the door ahead and grapple down. Finally, follow the path and collect the Mimo Abosi’s Relic.
Return Oluwa Cave

Return to Oluwa Cave and deliver the three relics, then open the chest ahead to collect the reward. Finally, use your new Supremo which will tag all the panthers, then defeat them quickly before reviving Oluso to bring this quest to a close.

content2.text: Guapo
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Guapo in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
How To Get Guapo

Guapo is a Crocodile that has his own unique looks with a stylish T-Shirt. This is a Combat Amigo that passively recovers health to keep fighting and self-revives after being downed in combat. You’ll first meet Guapo and unlock him after speaking with Juan in Armonia.
Chorizo
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Chorizo in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
How To Get Chorizo

Chorizo is a Dachshund Dog that is a Stealth Amigo with the ability to use his cuteness to distract enemies, allowing you to perform an easy stealth takedown. In order to unlock Chorizo you’ll need to play through the main story until you reach Montero Farm, then interact with the dog and complete the following missions:

Who’s a Good Boy?
Fetch Quest
Chicharrón
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Chicharrón in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
How To Get Chicharrón

Chicharrón is a Rooster Amigo that specializes in Combat. This friendly little companion will use his agility to quickly knock down enemies to the ground. In order to unlock Chicharrón you’ll need to complete the following Side Missions:

Man’s Best Enemy
Pecking Orders
Wingman
Boom Boom
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Boom Boom in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
How To Get Boom Boom

Boom Boom is another dog companion like Chorizo and his main ability is being able to collect resources from enemies’ bodies. In order to unlock Boom Boom you’ll need to complete the Quest, Boom or Bust. To do this, complete the operation Meet Maximas Matanzas which will unlock Camp Maximas, then you’ll need to interact with a note on a lamp post near Foreman’s Station.
Head East of Feroza to find the search area, then enter the building to find a blue crate that has Boom Boom waiting for you.
Oluso
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Oluso in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
How To Get Oluso
Oluso is a Panther Amigo with the ability to silently take down enemies. In order to unlock him you’ll need to complete the Side Quest, Triada Blessings.
Champagne (DLC)
This page is an overview of the Amigo, Champagne in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
About

Champagne is another panther Amigo like Oluso that can join you on your adventures through Yara. In order to unlock her you’ll need to own the VICE Pack DLC. Champagne’s main skill is stealing more money from dead enemies.
This page is an overview of the Amigo, K-9000 in Far Cry 6. Details on Abilities and how to unlock them.
About

K-9000 is another Amigo that can join you on your adventures through Yara. In order to unlock him you’ll need to own the Blood Dragon Pack which is included with the Season Pass and then complete the mission, The Guerilla. K-9000’s main ability allows him to take less damage from bullets and become immune to Poison and Fire.

content3.text: This page is a guide on if you should kill or leave McKay in Far Cry 6.

Play through the main story of Far Cry 6 until you reach the operation “The Deported”, then eventually you’ll find yourself face to face with McKay and you’ll be given a choice to either kill or just leave him alone.

This choice doesn’t affect anything in terms of the story, but it will change your reward. Killing Mckay will reward you with the Wrist Gear “Canadian, Eh?” which rewards you with extra Pesos upon killing enemies with poison. Other then this you’ll get a different bit of dialogue from Yelena at the end of the Operation.

Leaving McKay will give you 5000 Pesos at the end of the operation. Regardless of your choice here McKay will not be making any more appearances in the story. Alternatively, if you’d like to acquire the 5000 Pesos while still punishing McKay slightly, then you can shoot him once in the leg.
This page is a guide on how to get the Secret Ending in Far Cry 6.

In order to unlock the secret ending, you’ll need to play through the story until you complete the mission Libertad Rises and have helped create the HQ on Zamok Archipelago. Here a cutscene will play out and you’ll receive a rusty boat which you can use to get around Yara easier.

After the scene has come to a close, avoid speaking with Juan Cortez and take the boat to sail to the edge of the map until you see “Leaving Yara, Turn Around!” on your screen which will cause the secret ending to playout.

Once you’ve seen the ending you’ll receive the Trophy/Achievement Hidden In Plain Sight and then you’ll want to reload your save and you’ll find yourself in Esperanza. Here you can choose to explore the end-game area or fast travel to any of the previous areas to continue the game as normal.

content4.text: Crocodile Tears
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, Crocodile Tears. Details on where to find Luis’s stash.
Description
Rumor has it there’s treasure to be found deep inside The Blue Hole. I should check this out.
Find Luis’s stash

Head to the Ortega Croc Farm that is located at Cobre Shores which is to the east of Aguas Lindas. Here you’ll notice the place has been taken over by hungry crocodiles, so you’ll want to get the treasure quickly to avoid being their dinner. You’ll want to enter the pink building at the entrance and inspect the note to start the Treasure Hunt, then you’ll want to follow the path around until you reach the area that overlooks all the pens.

Clear out any nearby crocs, then look for a building with a red roof to find a corpse on the floor. Reload your weapons and make sure you have full health, then approach the corpse to be greeted by multiple crocodiles including Beatrice. Deal with them and then collect the key.

From here, go back up to the area overlooking the pens, then approach the windmill to find a grapple point. Use to swing over to the staffs home and unlock the door with recently acquired key to find the Lui’s Stash containing the Surf & Turf Rifle to bring this hunt to a close.
Cache Money
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, Cache Money. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to accessing the bunker and finding the Officer’s Room Key.
Description
I should uncover the secrets of this military storage facility.
Find The Confiscated Treasure
How To Open The Bunker Door

Head east of Oasis Plains in the Aguas Lindas Region to find the FND Storage Hub. Go over to the car park and interact with the note to begin the treasure hunt, then you’ll want to climb up to the roof of the building opposite the Bunker marked with a 2. You’ll find a switch that you’ll want to interact with to temporarily open the bunker doors. However, it’ll not be open long enough to enter, so before they close you’ll want to shoot the explosive barrels stored behind the door to break open the hatch on top.
How To Get Officer’s Room Key

Drop into the bunker via the now open hatch, then interact with the orange hatch inside and drop down into a corridor. Follow the path until you reach a room with a fenced off area and a locked Officer’s Room. Here you’ll now want to shoot the lock on the gate to access a room that has the Officer’s Room Key left on the bookshelf. Before leaving be sure to collect to look around at the Yaren History and collect Resources, such as Scrap and Metel.

Enter the Officer’s Room and interact with the switch which is located underneath the desk to reveal a hidden room, then open the chest containing Sobek Special Sniper Rifle.
Sword-Crossed Lovers
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, Sword-Crossed Lovers. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to finding the Pirates Treasure.
Description
An ancient treasure that once belonged to a pair of dueling pirate lovers lies in a skull-shaped cave. The treasure harbors a fatal curse but that’s not going to stop me from looking for it.
Find The Pirate Treasure
Locate the Pirate Ship

Head to Tormentoso Bay of the Barrial Region, then go over to the Calavera Cave entrance to accept the Treasure Hunt. Use your melee to break down the boarded door, then follow the path until you reach some stairs. Here you’ll want to use the grapple point to reach the upper section of the stairs and then continue following the path until you find yourself in an outside area.

Climb up the rocks until you reach some more stairs, then head all the way down and smash open another boarded up door. Inside you’ll see a Pirate Ship below, so dive into the water and swim to the back of it and attach yourself to the grapple point. Pull yourself up and swing to the front of the ship, then interact with the cannon to blow up a path.
Where To Find The La Petite Mort Grenade Launcher

Attach yourself to the grapple point again and swing up to the path on the right, then follow it along and go down the now accessible door to find the chest containing the La Petite Mort Grenade Launcher.
The Missing Muse
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, The Missing Muse. Details on where to find Rosa.
Description
A Yaran poet has left his poems scattered around the marina. They hint at his relationship with his missing lover, Rosa.
Find Rosa

Head northwest of the town of Segunda until you reach the Pez Volador Diving Club, then interact with the note at the entrance to begin the quest. Now go over to the Bar y buceo Pez Volador Marina. then collect the Ambrosio’s Key from the wall next to the numbers.

From here head up the top of the nearby tower and take the zipline down, then climb up the cliff and swim over to the buoy before diving and collecting the treasure from the back of the boat to complete the quest.
Oku's Triada Relic
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, Oku’s Triada Relic. It’ll navigate you through the necessary steps to acquiring Oku’s Relic.
Description
The Spanish fortress has remained untouched by the revolution. Military and even guerilla won’t enter it because they think it’s cursed. Could be the work of a Triada relic.
Oku’s Triada Relic Location

Head to Fort Oro which is located in the northwest corner of Cruz Del Salvador. Accept the quest, then enter the room on the right to find several mirrors. Here you’ll want to smash the first one next to the door to reveal a switch, then interact with it to open a door on the opposite side of the hallway. Read the Short Instructions on the table, then press the buttons on the center table in the following order:

Middle
Left
Right

Make your way upstairs and inspect the Note in Sheet Music Margins, then enter the now revealed secret room which contains a Dungeon Key. Now go back downstairs and unlock the final door, then head down into the basement. Shoot the boarded up door, then proceed into the room full of mannequin.

Interact with the red button at the back left of the room, then continue following the path around to find a grapple point that you’ll want to use to get up to the roof. Zipline down to the well, then use the grapple point above it to safely descend into. Finally, swing across to the ledge to acquire the Oku’s Triada Relic.
And the Beat Goes On…
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, And the Beat Goes On… Details on how to acquire the USB Stick containing the song AY Lola “La Figura” and the 1911 Pistol.
Description
An underground club has recently flooded. I should check out the cave and search for anything that can be salvaged.
Get the USB Stick from the DJ Booth.

Head to IDANZA! CAVE which is located northeast of the town of Seguna which is located in the Cruz Del Salvador Region. Upon arrival you’ll notice the entrance is boarded up, so you’ll need to smash it down with your melee attack, then proceed into the club. Here you’ll want to look up to find a grapple point on the disco ball. Attach yourself to it, then swing up to the left of it to find a switch that’ll you want to interact with to turn on the power.

Drop back down and hop over the electrified water and head through the now unlocked door. Follow the path ahead which is indicated by blue cloths, but as you get further in you’ll notice there is water that becomes electrified between jumps, so you’ll need to time it to avoid being caught in it. Eventually you’ll find a grapple point which you’ll want to use to slowly rappel down, then swing across to the platform to avoid more electrified water.

From here, climb up to a platform on the right which has a piano on it, then grapple across to the area opposite but make sure to avoid the electrified waterfall. Finally, collect the USB Stick from the Turntable and open up the stash below it for the 1911 Pistol and the Treasure Hunt will end.
The Man and the Mongoose
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, The Man and the Mongoose. Details on how to find Alvaro’s stash.
Description
A man having a feud with a mongoose? I have to check this out.
Find Alvaro’s stash

Head southwest of Paraiso Lagoon to reach Siniestra, then read the note attached to the post to begin this quest. Now shoot the lock on the gate and enter the fenced off area on the right, then go over to the shed and collect the key which is sitting on the wall.
Open the shed and quickly defeat the mongoose, then walk over to it and collect the Stash Key. Finally, enter the house in the fenced off area and open up the stash to bring this hunt to a close.
The Legend of La Princesa
This is a walkthrough for the Treasure Hunt, The Legend of La Princesa. Details on where to find the Treasure containing the Bait Charm
Description
Rumor has it there’s treasure to be found deep inside The Blue Hole. I should check this out.
Find the Treasure Of La Princesa

Head to The Blue Hole Cave which is located northwest of Aguda Cliffs in Costa Del Mar. Interact with the note attached to the post to learn more about the Legend of La Princesa and the Treasure Hunt will begin. Hop over the fence and use the grapple point, then rappel down into the water.

Avoid the jellyfishes, as they will be able to kill quickly if you remain in contact for too long. From here, swim through the cave until you reach a point you can climb out, then dive back in and continue onward until you reach another point you can climb out. Follow the path around until you reach a third pool of water, then dive in and follow the path until you can get out again.

Like before, exit and follow the path until you reach a forth pool of water, then when you dive into the water you’ll notice there are two paths you can take. The right is the correct one, but the left will lead you to some Metel. As you reach the end of the right path, exit the water and follow the path up until you get higher enough to attach to the grapple point, then use it to swing up to the treasure. Finally, open the Treasure Chest for the Bait Charm and the hunt will come to a close.

content5.text: There are four Rides to find throughout Yara in Far Cry 6 and this page will navigate you to successfully acquiring them.
How To Unlock Juan’s 1956 Beaumont Valentina
This Ride is automatically unlocked when you accept the Main Mission, Fuel the Revolution.
How To Unlock Yami’s 2008 KAG TG

You’ll acquire the Yaren Story Backseat Driver after you’ve been at Montero Farm in the story for a short period of time. This quest takes you to Aguas Lindasr which is Rank 7, so make sure you complete this mission quickly as progressing the story too much will increase its level. You’ll have this Ride in your possession after completing the mission.
In order to acquire the 1962 Verrazzano Bravo you’ll need to complete one of the twelve Gran Premio Races. You’ll find them in the following locations.

Head Northeast of Catalina Ridge to find an FND Storage Facility. Upon arrival, go to the back of the building and use the excavator arm to get through the door, then shoot the yellow boxes to reach the Ride. Once you’ve driven out of the garage you’ll be given the Trophy/Achievement Car Cry
How To Get The Angelito FW Turbo Flying Car
This page is a guide on how to get the Angelito FW Turbo Flying Car in Far Cry 6.
How To Unlock the Angelito FW Turbo Flying Car

Once you’ve started clearing out a fair few of the anti-aircraft guns, then you’ll want a good flying vehicle to roam the skies of Yara in. Acquiring the Angelito FW Turbo Flying Car will take a little bit of time as you’ll need to build up your supply of Metal and Gasolina.

Progress through the story until you’ve completed the Meet The Monteros Operation, then speak with Foreman at the Construction Desk and unlock the Hideout Network to reveal the locations of Hideouts throughout Yara. Now you’ll want to upgrade it to the second tier which will then guarantee a vehicle to always spawn at the hideouts.

Next up you’ll want to travel southwest of Palma Forest in the Lozania Region to find the Hideout Charanga. Collect the Angelito FW Turbo Flying Car which is sitting outside, then fly to the nearest pickup point to unlock it permanently.

content6.text: How To Play Cockfighting
Cockfighting is a sport in Far Cry 6 and real life that involves taking two Roosters and placing them into a ring to fight it out.
Where to find Cockfighting

In order to play Cockfighting you’ll need to play through the main story until you reach the Montero Farm in Costa Del Mar, then speak with Ivan Minoso who can be found standing near the Cockfighting Ring.

After the conversation has come to a close, collect your first Rooster from the wooden box next to Ivan, then Interact with Ivan again and you’ll find yourself taken in the Fight Screen. Here you’ll be given the choice between three difficulties, Civilian, Guerilla, and Revolutionary. However, in order to unlock the harder difficulties you’ll need to increase your Civilian Rank. Upon winning a Cockfight you’ll be rewarded with Yaran Pesos.

Note
Cockfighting is a great way to make Yaran Pesos.
How To Win a Cockfight

Cockfighting is a pretty simple mini-game once you’ve played a couple rounds and have gotten used to the controls. Your best strategy to winning every battle is by waiting for the opponent to strike you, then go in with a Long Range Attack followed by a Close Range Attack. Repeat this until the red bar below your health is charged, then press L1 + R1 to trigger the Gallo Super Rage Mode Attack.
How To Get More Roosters

There are up to 19 Roosters for you to own in Far Cry 6, but only 13 of them can be found scattered around Yara and the remaining six are unlocked through Ubisoft Connect Rewards. Be sure to check out our Rooster Locations page to find out where to find them!
Rooster Locations

Roosters are something you can take into the Cockfighting Ring In Far Cry 6. There are a total of 19, but only 13 of them can be found in the world whereas the remaining six are acquired from Ubisoft Connect Rewards. Upon acquiring the 13 around the world you’ll be given the Trophy/Achievement Recrooster
Where To Find El Rato
Head to Montero Farm in the Costa Del Mar Region, then go over to the Cockfighting Ring to find El Rato sitting inside a wooden box behind Elvis.
Where To Find Acero
Head to the town of Verdera in the Lozania Region, then go to the northwest corner to find Acero sitting in a box next to a house.
Where To Find El Dorado

You’ll have to wait until you acquire the Yaran Story “Spur of the Moment ‘’ which takes you to a bunker that is located in Catelejo Ridge. Progress through the bunker until you enter an open room and you’ll find El Dorado sitting in a box in the corner.
Where To Find El Aguila
Head over to Cortina River in the Costa Del Mar Region, then climb up to the top of the mountain and you’ll find El Aguila sitting in a box at the edge of the cliff.
Where To Find El Pico
Head over to the Botanical Gardens of Yara in the Noventarmas Region, then follow the path south to find El Pico sitting in a box on the side of a blue building.
Where To Find Papacito
Head to the Castillo National Zoo which is located in Diamante Lakes of the Balacera Region. Here you’ll want to go to the northeast corner of the zoo to find Papacito sitting in a Chicken Coop.
Where To Find El Fenix

Head to Muerte Point which is located in the Barrial Region, then follow the path west until you find a bunch of chickens running about in a gated room. Enter and you’ll find El Fenix sitting in a box.
Where To Find La Muerte Negra
Head to the town of Segunda which is located in the Cruz Del Salvador Region, then go western outskirts to find La Muerte Negra sitting in a box inside a pen.
Where To Find El Huevo

Head to Mirador Cape of the La Joya Region, then travel southwest until you stumble across the La Joya PDP office. Enter the building and go up to the second floor, then shoot the lock of the gated room to find El Huevo sitting inside a box.
Where To Find El Gallo Magnifico

Like El Dorado you’ll need to wait until you have acquired the Yaran Story Everything to Lose. Travel to Arrese Farm which is located in the Conuco Region and he’ll ask you to take his fighting Rooster. However, you’ll need to enter the nearby house and collect the Shed Key before you can collect El Gallo Magnifico.
Where To Find Hermoso
Head to the Savannah Fields of the Sierra Perdida Region and you’ll find Hermoso sitting in a box inside a pen of Bonilla Farm.
Where To Find La Bala De Plata

Head over to Vacia Coast of the Sierra Perdida Region, then head northwest until you reach Alvarez Farm. Here you’ll want to look for a cart and you’ll find La Bala De Plata sitting in a box on the back.
Where To Find La Bestia Blanca

Head to West Lado which is located in the Esperanza Region, then travel northwest until you reach the Casas del Lodo Residences. Enter the building and you’ll find La Bestia Blanca sitting in a box in the kitchen.

content7.text: USB Stick Locations

USB Sticks are something you can find around Yara in Far Cry 6. There are a total of 15 and they allow you to play different soundtracks in your vehicle. Upon collecting all 15 you’ll get the Trophy/Achievement That's My Jam
Where to find the Hitboy USB Stick
Head southeast of the Ventura Summit in the Quito Region until you reach Acunana Farmland, then you’ll find the USB Stick containing the Hitboy sitting in the warehouse.
Where to find the Pulpa De Tamarindo USB Stick
Head to Cortina Peninsula of the Costa Del Mar Region, then go into the Ocao Marina Enemy Base to find the USB Stick containing the song Pulpa De Tamarindo sitting on a table against a metal fence.
Where to find the Sentimiento Original USB Stick
Head to Jardina Cay of the Aguas Lindas Region, then go over to the Hideout Mambo and look in the bins to find the USB Stick containing the song Sentimiento Original.
Where to find the What A Bam Bam USB Stick
Head to the town of Vedera of the Lozania Region, then go to the building with scaffolding to find the USB Stick containing the song What A Bam Bam sitting on a table by a laptop.
Where to find the Abuso De Poder USB Stick
Head to the FDA Airbase Olmpia of the Aguas Lindas Region, then climb up to the roof of the radio tower to find the USB Stick containing the song Abuso De Poder on the floor.
Where to find the Ay Lola La Figura USB Stick

Head northeast of the Segunda Town of the Cruz Del Salvador Region until you find the Treasure Hunt, And The Beat Goes On. Complete it, then collect the USB Stick containing the song Ay Lola La Figura on the decks.
Where to find the Educate Ya USB Stick
Head northwest of the town of Feroza in the Balaceras Region to find the USB Stick containing the song Educate Ya sitting in a laptop of a small building.
Where to find the Macarena (Bayside Boys Remix) USB Stick
Head east of the Oku Creek Checkpoint in the Barrial Region to find the USB Stick containing the song Macarena (Bayside Boys Remix) sitting inside a bin.
Where to find the Dinero USB Stick
Head west of Muerte Point in the Barrial Region to find the USB Stick containing the song Dinero on the roof building.
Where to find the La Bella Ciao De Libertad USB Stick
Head northwest of Catalina Ridge in the La Joya Region to find the USB Stick containing the song La Bella Ciao De Libertad sitting in a bunker of the Turgenev Comms Post.
Where to find the Los Caminos De La Vida USB Stick
Head to Casa Rivera which is located in Fernando Valley of the Conuco Region, then you’ll find a USB Stick containing the song Los Caminos De La Vida sitting on the balcony of a house.
Where to find the Yo Aprendi USB Stick
Head to the village of Madito in the Conuco Region, then look for a small shack where you’ll find the USB Stick containing the song Yo Aprendi on the desk.
Where to find the La Vida Me Cambio USB Stick
Head to the Sureño Shipyards which is located southwest of Robustas Hills in the Sierra Perdida, then you’ll find the USB Stick containing the song La Vida Me Cambió in the entrance offices.
Where to find the PXSSY POWAH! USB Stick
Head to the Mercurio Mechanico Hideout of Esperanza Region, then you’ll find the USB Stick containing the song PXSSY POWAH! sitting on a desk on the top floor.
Where to find the Here We Kum USB Stick
Head to the Barrio Antiguo area of the Esperanza Region, then you’ll find the USB Stick containing the song Here We Kum sitting in a storage room up on the rooftop.

content8.text: How To Get All Supremo Backpacks

In Far Cry 6 you’ll be able to purchase Supremo Backpacks from Juan on Libertad Island which give you a variety of powerful skills, such as being able to fire Rockets with the Exterminador Backpack. Additionally, you can add extra accessories to the backpack such as Gas Grenades to use whilst waiting for the special ability to recharge.
How To Get The Exterminador Supremo Backpack

You’ll automatically be given the Exterminador Backpack by Juan during the main story. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability Armaggeddon Strike which will fire multiple rockets at nearby enemies. This Backpack becomes incredibly useful when trying to destroy vehicles.
How To Get The Fantasma Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to purchase the Fantasma Backpack from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability Venom Salvo which will unleash poison around you causing any nearby enemies to turn against each other.
How To Get The Gladiador Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to purchase the Fantasma Backpack from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium at Rank 5. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability Juice Injector which will give you an adrenaline rush causing your Speed and Health to be increased.
How To Get The Triador Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to unlock this Backpack by completing the Yaren Story Triada Blessings. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability Truesight which will let you see and mark nearby enemies through walls. Additionally, if you combine this with weapon La Varita then you can shoot the enemies through the walls when the ability is active.
How To Get The Volta Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to purchase the Volta Backpack from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability El Impulso which will emit an EMP Pulse causing enemies to be knocked over and disables nearby security systems.
How To Get The Furioso Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to purchase the Furioso Backpack from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium when you’re Rank 3. This Backpack comes equipped with the special ability Fuego Loco which will unleash a ring of fire around you causing nearby enemies to be incinerated.
How To Get The Medico Supremo Backpack

You’ll be able to purchase the Medico Backpack from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium when you’re Rank 4. This comes equipped with the special ability Zona Medicina which will cause your health to replenish faster and you can self revive.
Best Supremo Backpacks
There are seven Supremo Backpacks to find in Far Cry, but you may be wondering which three are the best to use whilst you tackle the variety of opponents you’ll face in Yara.
Furioso Supremo Backpack

The Furioso Backpack can be purchased from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium when you’re Rank 3. This backpack is a great one to take on your journey, as it gives you the ability to thrust forward which is good for getting to your objectives faster. Additionally, it allows you to perform an Explosive which is great if you get surrounded by multiple enemies.
Médico Supremo Backpack

The Medico Backpack which you can purchase from Juan’s Weapon Shop for 100 Depleted Uranium when you’re Rank 4 is another great choice if you tackle Yara solo, as it increases health regeneration and allows you to self-revive.
Triador Supremo Backpack

The Triador Backpack which you can get from completing Yaren Story Triada Blessing is a perfect fit for a stealthy player, as it allows you to see and mark enemies whilst in cover. If you pair this backpack up with the La Varita Rifle you’ll be able to shoot the enemies through the walls.
Best Weapons
There are multiple weapons to find and use in Yara, so here is a rundown on the top five guns you’ll want to use as you take down Antón Castillo’s Army in Far Cry 6.
How To Get La Varita Rifle

The La Varita Rifle is a great choice for stealthy players, as if you pair it up with the Triador Supremo Backpack you’ll be able to tag and shoot enemies through walls. In order to acquire this rifle you’ll need to complete the Yaren Story Triada Blessings.
How To Get El Tirano

El Tirano is a Sniper Rifle equipped with armour-piercing rounds and a suppressor. This allows you to take down most enemies with a single shot at a distance which makes capturing the enemy bases stealthily much easier.

To acquire this weapon you’ll want to go to Escila Fort and climb up to the top of the lighthouse where you’ll find it waiting in a crate.
How To Get Supercharger

The Supercharger Shotgun is a great secondary choice to take along with an Assault Rifle, as if you find you’ll be able to take out enemies if you find yourself up close and personal. Along with this Supercharger comes equipped with a suppressor, so you’ll be able to remain hidden whilst using it.

To acquire this shotgun, head to the GDP Oil Platform which is located in the northwest corner of the map, then go to the northwest corner of the platform to find a control room. Interact with the red button which will lift a blue container into the air, then go into the now accessible container to find Supercharger sitting in a box.
How To Get Crackle and Pop

The Crackle and Pop is an LMG is great for aggressive players as you’ll be able to clear large groups of enemies with its large magazine. This LMG also comes equipped with Blast Rounds which allows you to take down vehicles quickly, so helicopters won’t be as much of a threat anymore.

In order to unlock the Crackle and Pop you’ll want to go up to El Rayo Cinema which is located in Esperanza. Upon arrival, climb up to the rooftop of the cinema and open the crate to acquire the Crackle and Pop.
How To Get Into Orbit

Into Orbit is a rocket launcher that makes taking down enemy vehicles from a distance due to its homing rockets which makes it perform better then other available launchers in the game. In order to unlock the Into Orbit rocket launcher you’ll need to complete the Treasure Hunt Liquid Courage.
